attributes.action: Protect the Right to Trial by Jury
attributes.additional_details: We urge the Government not to pursue any reforms that would abolish or limit the right to trial by jury. Jury trials are a fundamental democratic protection, allowing ordinary citizens to take part in the justice process. Any move to weaken this right would risk reducing transparency and fairness.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to commit publicly to retaining the right to trial by jury in England and Wales. Trial by jury is a long-standing safeguard in the justice system, ensuring fairness, independence, and public confidence. We want the Government to rule out any proposals of this.

rejection.details:
We already have a petition open on this subject, which you may wish to sign here:

Do not remove trial by jury for certain cases
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751480
